data.meanings: to serve, worship or adore; to protect, grant refuge, preserve save, rescue, liberate; object of worship ie God; (Alif-Lam-Lam-ha) God, the one true God applied as a proper name denoting the true god, comprising all the excellent divine names; a unity comprising all the essences of existing things.
data.sentence: The word اللَّهُ comes from the root ا ل ه and is associated with the meanings: to serve, worship or adore; to protect, grant refuge, preserve save, rescue, liberate; object of worship ie God; (Alif-Lam-Lam-ha) God, the one true God applied as a proper name denoting the true god, comprising all the excellent divine names; a unity comprising all the essences of existing things.

data.meanings: (Kaf-Alif-Nun) To be, exist, happen, occur, take place, become, be such or so.
data.sentence: The word وَكَانَ comes from the root ك و ن and is associated with the meanings: (Kaf-Alif-Nun) To be, exist, happen, occur, take place, become, be such or so.

data.meanings: to do something, He did it, the suffering or receiving the effect of an act, to commit, a doing, to do a deed, a custom/habit/manner/wont.
data.sentence: The word يَفْعَلُ comes from the root ف ع ل and is associated with the meanings: to do something, He did it, the suffering or receiving the effect of an act, to commit, a doing, to do a deed, a custom/habit/manner/wont.

data.meanings: to mark/sign/distinguish, creations/beings, world, science/learning/knowledge/information, aware/know. By means of which one knows a thing, hence it signifies world or creation, because by it the Creator is known. alim (pl. ulama) - one who is learned/wise or knows.
data.sentence: The word عَلِيمًا comes from the root ع ل م and is associated with the meanings: to mark/sign/distinguish, creations/beings, world, science/learning/knowledge/information, aware/know. By means of which one knows a thing, hence it signifies world or creation, because by it the Creator is known. alim (pl. ulama) - one who is learned/wise or knows.

data.meanings: chastisement, castigate, punishment, torture, torment, retribution, abstain/desist, relinquish, quit.adhb - sweet (usually water), e.g. 25:53, 35:12.
data.sentence: The word بِعَذَابِكُمْ comes from the root ع ذ ب and is associated with the meanings: chastisement, castigate, punishment, torture, torment, retribution, abstain/desist, relinquish, quit.adhb - sweet (usually water), e.g. 25:53, 35:12.

data.meanings: to give thanks, be grateful, realize or acknowledge one's favour, praise. shukrun - giving thanks, gratitude. shaakirun - one who gives thanks or is grateful, appreciated and bountiful in reward.. shakruurun - thankful. Sometimes a distinction is made between this word and shaakirun. The former is used to denote a person who is thankful for little or for nothing, the latter grateful for large favours.. mashkuurun - gratefully accepted, acceptable.
data.sentence: The word شَكَرْتُمْ comes from the root ش ك ر and is associated with the meanings: to give thanks, be grateful, realize or acknowledge one's favour, praise. shukrun - giving thanks, gratitude. shaakirun - one who gives thanks or is grateful, appreciated and bountiful in reward.. shakruurun - thankful. Sometimes a distinction is made between this word and shaakirun. The former is used to denote a person who is thankful for little or for nothing, the latter grateful for large favours.. mashkuurun - gratefully accepted, acceptable.

data.meanings: become/feel safe/secure, state of security/safety, trust, become quiet/tranquil in heart/mind, become free of expectation of evil or free of an object of dislike/hatred, promise/assurance of security/safety, become trustful/faithful/confident, to believe/acknowledge it, manifestation of humility/submission
data.sentence: The word وَءَامَنْتُمْ comes from the root ا م ن and is associated with the meanings: become/feel safe/secure, state of security/safety, trust, become quiet/tranquil in heart/mind, become free of expectation of evil or free of an object of dislike/hatred, promise/assurance of security/safety, become trustful/faithful/confident, to believe/acknowledge it, manifestation of humility/submission
